Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power back on

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine a transformer on our electricity poles to check it is functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future as we appreciate you may have been impacted by an unplanned fault in the last 6 months. This work is taking place near Luxon Road.

Steps.Message: Good morning, this is a message from Ryan at UK Power Networks regarding the planned power cut which is currently in progress today the 5th of November 2025 in the RH12 postcode area. Our contractors have advised us that the 198 affected properties will be restored early at approximately 11:00. This is following concerns from a local primary school that has gone off supply, so our engineers are looking to restore supplies as soon as possible to minimise the impact to them and affected customers. We can confirm that once power has been restored to the area that the works to test a transformer on Faygate Lane will be completed which will improve the reliability of the network and reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future. Our reference number for this work is INCD-326602-U. I hope that the power coming on earlier is of benefit to you. We always aim to provide a 10/10 service, if you feel we have not delivered you a 10/10 service then please call us on 105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of our equipment in your area. This has identified a piece of equipment called a transformer that needs replacing and upgrading. To reduce future planned power cuts we also need to examine a transformer to ensure it is working to the best of its ability. We appreciate some customers may have experienced unplanned power cuts and planned power cuts in the last 6 months. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future. To complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off and upgrade the transformer. We will remove the existing one and install a new one on the same day. This work is taking place near Hoo Hall and Hoo Wood Cottages in Hoo.

This has identified trees that have grown close, which could damage the cables and affect your electricity supply. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future. This work is taking place east of Higham Lane.

These trees could cause damage to the cables and affect your electricity supply. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future. This work is taking place on Straight Road.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: Our engineers are diverting our high and low voltage underground electricity cables at the request of a third party. This is to allow for new building works to be constructed. Doing this will give the third party their desired outcome and reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut whilst the works take place. Our engineers need to temporarily switch off your power so we can safely carry out the work. Doing this will ensure our network is safe whilst works commence in the area. This work is taking place in the Broadwater Forest Lane area.

To ensure the power is off for the shortest possible time, our contractors Avidety may carry out preparation works prior to the power cut. Avidety will need access to the inside of your property to conduct safety checks in the morning before we switch off the power and we will need to do another check when we turn the power back on. This work is taking place near Westward Lane. A road closure will be in place to allow the work to be carried out safely. Access to your property will always be provided.

For any more information, please visit our website or call us on 105. Thank you.

Steps.Message:
We're sorry your power has now been off for several hours and we're working as quickly as possible to get you back on.

We know you may be concerned about your phone battery running low, so here are some tips on how you can prolong battery life: Set your phone to power saving mode, reduce screen brightness, turn off WiFi, Bluetooth and GPS (if not in use), cut apps running in the background and if possible top up using a car charger or portable battery pack.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Winter is here and temperatures are low, so we understand that it can be very concerning to have a power cut as this may have affected your heating.

Should you have a gas hob, you may be able to carefully ignite it with matches or a lighter in order for you to warm up with a hot drink or meal. Please only attempt this if you are confident it can be done safely.

If you have someone in the property who may be more vulnerable to the cold please do not hesitate to call us free on 105.

We will do our best to provide additional care and support whilst work continues to get your power back on ASAP.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.

Our engineers are still working to restore your power.

With darkness now upon us we understand that it can be unsettling to have a power cut. It may help to locate a torch and anything else you may need so you can have it to hand just in case.

If you have any concerns please do not hesitate to contact our team, but we will work to fix the problem as quickly and safely as possible. Sent by Kevin at 18:05.

Steps.Message:
Hello, Kevin from the messaging team here. Thanks for your patience today, our field staff and control room engineers are working to get your power back on as quickly as they can.

Our records show that some properties affected by today's power cut may have had other unexpected interruptions recently. If you have, we're sorry for further disruption. All power cuts are fully investigated by our engineers but can sometimes happen multiple times before we can safely find the issue and fix it.

We know that not everyone affected by today's power cut will have had other power cuts recently, but we want you to know that if you have, our customer services team will try to update as many customers as possible about our investigations.

Our staff have now confirmed that our substation equipment has operated due to an underground cable fault which we'll need to pinpoint, excavate and repair. We're sending specialist teams and equipment to site, and it's possible they will still be able to restore your power within the current time frame using other methods. However, once they've assessed further we'll let you know if the time frame needs to change. For more information about this type of fault; here's a short video https://bit.ly/2ScxQDZ - I'll keep you updated.

Sent by Lisa at 18:25 - Engineers are on their way. At this point we think the issue is a fault with equipment in your local substation in the Lennard Road area. We didn't know this was going to happen, so time frames we provide throughout are estimated and are subject to change.

Our estimated time to have power back on is currently between 22:00 and 23:00, but after we arrive and assess the situation this may change. The reason for this is there can sometimes be a more complex underlying issue found by our engineer's tests which may take longer, and if not we may get power back on sooner.

All of our texts are written and sent personally by our team, and we'll let you know once our staff arrive.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Lisa at 14:34 - We can now confirm that all power in the area should be back on. Our engineers had to unexpectedly turn off the power for safety at the request of the fire brigade in the Tunnel Avenue area.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi there. We've just had a shift change, so Stuart, Kevin and Lisa are now here to keep you updated with progress from our field teams.

We know it's frustrating being without power, but we wanted to assure you we're still here and as soon as we have some more information from the fire brigade, and are able to progress with work we'll update you again.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Good morning, we're sorry you're still without power today. We are still waiting for the all clear from the fire brigade to be able to carry out repairs on our side of things and restore supplies.

Due to this, we are currently unable to provide you with an estimated time frame. As the issue is complex won't be texting you as often as we might normally, but I assure you if we get any relevant information from our staff, we'll let you know as soon as possible. 

If you have any further questions or concerns though, don't hesitate to call us free on 08003163105. Sent by Will at 06:57.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Will at 12:48 - Thanks for your patience today, we're happy to say our staff have now restored power to all but two properties in the Mawson Close area. I'm sorry for any disruption we caused by having to turn off your power to repair an unexpected underground network fault.

We'd still like to keep you informed if your electricity hasn't been restored. Please call us free any time on 08003163105 if we haven't already reached out to you by phone or in person at your property.

We apologise for the outage and understand that being without power can be challenging. Rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep your lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Will at 12:14 - We're very sorry we've had to switch off your electricity. Our engineers have turned off the power in the Mawson Close area for safety so they can repair an underground network fault. Our estimated time to have your power back on is between 13:30 and 14:30, however, this may need to change later depending on how our works progress. If you'd like more information about why we sometimes have to switch power off to work; here's a short video https://bit.ly/3cYez0V. We'll keep you updated with progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Our engineers have arrived on site in the Herbert Road area, the estimated time of 15:00 - 16:00 hasn't changed. We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress, but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Talie at 11:35 - Engineers are on their way. At this point we think the issue is a fault with equipment in your local substation in the Herbert Road area. We didn't know this was going to happen, so time frames we provide throughout are estimated and are subject to change.

Our estimated time to have power back on is currently between 15:00 and 16:00, but after we arrive and assess the situation this may change. The reason for this is there can sometimes be a more complex underlying issue found by our engineer's tests which may take longer, and if not we may get power back on sooner.

All of our texts are written and sent personally by our team, and we'll let you know once our staff arrive.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Stuart at 16:13 - We can now confirm that all power in the Target Firs area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected fault with some of our network equipment, which our engineers have now replaced.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Stuart at 14:56 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Talie at 08:25 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 215 customers in the RM4 and CM14 area, by diverting power around an overhead cable fault. This means we have been able to restore power sooner than we anticipated, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hello, Talie from the messaging team here. Thanks for your patience today, our field staff and control room engineers have worked to get your power back on as quickly as they can.

Our records show that some properties affected by today's power cut may have had other unexpected interruptions recently. If you have, we're sorry for further disruption. All power cuts are fully investigated by our engineers but can sometimes happen multiple times before we can safely find the issue and fix it.

We know that not everyone affected by today's power cut will have had other power cuts recently, but we want you to know that if you have, our customer services team will try to update as many customers as possible about our investigations.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Talie at 07:45 - Our engineers are on their way. At this point we think the issue is an overhead cable fault affecting 86 properties.

Specialist engineers from our control room are also working to divert power remotely, so it's possible your power could come back on at any point. We can't always restore everyone this way. That's why we're also sending staff to the area to check our equipment.

Every fault is different, so our time frames have to be estimated but currently we hope to have power back on between 08:30 and 09:30. We must stress that it may become necessary for this to change, depending on what our engineers find.

We'll keep you updated with our progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Zainab at 15:30 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers repair a high voltage overhead network fault in the IP13 0, IP13 9 and IP13 7 area. We have now restored power to all but one property. We're sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused.

If your power isn't back on, we'd still like to keep you updated. If we aren't currently in contact with you by phone or in person at your property, please call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have arrived on site in the IP13 0, IP13 9 and IP13 7 area to investigate the power cut affecting 377 properties.

Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Sent by Kevin at 14:22.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team
